alert.note: Alert for Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 18 at 9:25AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON MST TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of north central Arizona, including the following areas, Grand Canyon Country, Kaibab Plateau and Marble and Glen Canyons. * WHEN...From Noon MST today through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Flash flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, swimming holes and over recently burned areas. Low-water crossings could also experience flash flooding, which would create deadly travel conditions. Consider changing your plans if you were going to hike, boat, or paddleboard to a slot canyon or normally dry wash. If you do still decide to recreate, check in at a nearby visitor center or ranger station. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A westerly moving area of low pressure will enhance the probability of heavy rain and subsequent flash flooding over portions of northern Arizona from Friday through Saturday evening over areas that have already had significant rainfall over the past week. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Grand Canyon Country; Kaibab Plateau; Marble and Glen Canyons
